sentence.text: Besides dramatic metabolic alterations, cancer cells display severe changes in the protein acetylation phenotype with likely consequences in tumor progression and treatment response.

In this study, we use a comprehensive systems-driven approach to investigate the effect of protein acetylation disruption on metabolic pathways and its negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II on drug response in a cellular model of colon cancer progression.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: A mapping of the expression data to a comprehensive genome-scale reconstruction of human metabolism allowed for the in-depth functional characterization of 24â€¯h-oscillating transcripts and pointed to a protein acetylation-driven metabolic reprogramming in tumorigenesis.
We further identified a reciprocal connection of cellular glucose homeostasis to the protein acetylation in the primary tumor, which is lost in the metastatic cells.

This work provides novel evidence regarding the complex interplay between the circadian protein acetylation and metabolic alterations in carcinogenesis and identifies new connections between both systems with pivotal roles in cancer progression and response to therapy
